intro: Isopetalum cotyledonis, commonly known as the cotyledon isopetalum, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers with yellow disc florets surrounded by white ray florets. Its leaves are typically narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs. Isopetalum cotyledonis is adapted to grow in rocky, coastal environments, showcasing its resilience to harsh conditions.
